ratings.comment: Dr. Block is a great lecturer. He explains difficult concepts very clearly. He is beyond knowledgable, which allows his lectures to be thorough and digestible. He also gives lots of feedback in class that is helpful for exams. If you pay attention to the lectures, this course is not very difficult. He is also very funny and kind, which is a plus.

By far the better of the two 109 professors, I had Jacelyn Trate and would skip her lecture to attend Block's. His lectures are very organized and well structured, he also goes over tons of test-like questions in depth during lecture,which is super helpful.
He is such a good lecturer, highly recomend!

Stephen is a wonderful professor. You can tell he really cares about the material he is teaching. Reading the textbook and talking notes before class is so helpful for both the podias and the lecture. Tough class but Stephen made it not that bad.

Dr. Block is an incredible professor who made CHEM 109 far less difficult than it could've been. His lectures are entertaining and he presents the content in a very digestible manner. He is also insanely attentive to Piazza if you have any questions. Dr. Block is definitely going to be one of the best (if not the best) professors I'll ever have

While the course itself can be challenging, Dr. Block has really engaging and easy-to-follow lectures. As long as you stay on top of work and attend/watch posted lectures, you'll be fine. It's obvious Dr. Block cares about his students and loves teaching.

All-around fantastic lecturer. I felt like I had a clear idea of what I had to do, when I had to do it, and how I had to do it. Even when discussion boring concepts, can keep you engaged with a good sense of humor. If you're STEM-inclined but haven't taken AP Chem like me, I'd definitely recommend trying CHEM 109 with Professor Block!

I can't say much that has not been said already (he is great, all around), but I will add something new: Without going into details, there was a TA that was being very unfair to students, and he did everything in his power to ensure that his students were treated fairly and given the respect they deserve. Awsome guy, all around.

Dr. Block is an amazing professor. It's clear that he cares about his students and wants them to succeed. His lectures are very engaging He's also very approachable, I emailed him a few times with questions and his replies were always timely and thorough. The class itself is hard, I did well in AP Chem, but expect to be studying a lot regardless.

This is a very fast paced course but I personally believe that Professor Block does a very good job making good use of lectures. He is very thorough and does a good job of making difficult to understand material understandable.

The class itself is very time-consuming, but Professor Block made it more enjoyable.  There is no curve at the end of the semester, and the pre class work is a lot, but it all ends up very useful for the exams.  Block is very funny and I loved him as a professor.  I took AP chem, but this course was challenging.

As someone who didn't take AP chem, this class was hell but not because of Block (although he enjoys torturing students with TERRIBLE labs). Exams are so hard (60-70% average) but if you lock in for every lab and homework assignment most people can get an A if they put in the work. Overall I recommend 109 over 103/104, especially with Block.

Professor Block is one of the best Chemistry Professors at UW-Madison. His lecture notes are handwritten and easy to follow. He sprinkles in some jokes here and there in lecture and overall a very enjoyable experience for my first general chemistry college class.

Dr. Block is a very engaging lecturer and proved to be very helpful in understanding a tough concept like general chem. Reading the textbook does a lot in this class the daily readings will guide the course. Dr. Block does a good job summarizing the concepts in class to where I felt I didn't always need to read. I recommend taking 109 with Dr Block
The class is hard, but he is very knowledgeable. He talks fast and every lecture is up to the bell, but he's a good professor and cares about students doing well.

Never took AP chemistry in high school, so this class was rough, and I don't think i could've passed with an A without this professor. There was a lot of homework and reading, but the lectures were straightforward, and the professor was funny. If you're taking chem 109, take it with Block.

Dr. Block is a very effective lecturer. He made the subject very engaging, despite gen chem usually being boring. He always gave clear feedback and was very clearly passionate about teaching. Would recommend taking chem 109 over chem 103/104 if you have the option. The class has no final, just 5 unit exams which is much less stressful.

Professor Block is an amazing lecturer who makes a challenging class enjoyable. His clear explanations, engaging style, and dedication to student success are unparalleled. Unstuck ai was a game-changer for my study prep.
Professor Block is a very engaging lecturer!
Dr. Block is fantastic, and I am especially grateful for his clear expectations and extremely helpful lectures. He genuinely cares and is clearly knowledgeable. Highly recommend.

Made a difficult class such as Chem 109 bearable and in fact enjoyable. Hardly skipped the lectures even though attendance was not required. Performed experiments in front of class, made witty jokes, and showed personality as a professor. Very approachable and would come to labs to check out the students work. Genuinely great human being.
A professor who is a genuine human being.

Dr. Block is probably the best professor I will have at my time at UW. You can tell that he really cares about his students and wants us all to do well. His response time on piazza was just incredible; I would get quick responses even if I asked questions late at night. If you put in time and try your best you can secure an A

Amazing lectures. Dr. Block is personable, incredible at explaining these incredibly complex topics, he's insanely smart, but still makes class fun. He posts blank slides that serve as notes for the lectures, and I found them super effective at preparing me for exams. I truly think he has a gift for teaching and would recommend him to anyone in109.

Dr. Block was an amazing professor! Despite attendance not being mandatory, his lectures were always packed. Chem 109 is a great course to take if you have taken AP chem in high school or want to challenge yourself. The class is graded on a good mix of your labs, exams, homework, and discussions and the grading was very forgiving. 10/10

Dr.Block is a well spoken professor who not only teaches the curriculum in an easy to understand manner, he also makes lectures engaging and fun. He shows compassion for his students and has goals to make relationships with his class. I would not recommend any professor more than Dr.Block due to his dedication to his job and students success.

Dr. Block is not only an amazing professor, well spoken, and entertaining in lecture, he is also a great and compassionate man. He genuinely cares about his students and is accessible outside of class.

I loved taking Dr. Block's class! He's a great professor who obviously knows a lot about chemistry and is also very enthusiastic about teaching it. He's funny, his lectures are easy to follow, and he's helpful if you have questions.
Did an amazing job teaching concepts and relating to students. I will miss having him as my professor.
Chem 109 is really hard but Stephen is a good professor that cares about his students. His office hours are really helpful and his lectures are really clear.

Chem 109 was a very difficult course, but Professor Block made it doable. Make sure you go to every discussion, lecture, and lab because the tests are hard so any extra points are worth your time. It is a very time consuming class, but the lecture notes are clear and easy to follow (as long as you do the reading before).

Professor Block is a good professor, and he teaches well. Chem 109 is a difficult course so I think he did the best he could and was pretty helpful. However, his tests were very hard, and the grading criteria was harsh and sometimes not very clear in the sense that I would lose points for the tiniest things.
His lectures and slides were easy to follow! Chem109 was hard but he tried his best for us to make the material digestible.

Professor Block was truly a great professor. During the lectures he kept the class engaged by jokes, interesting stories about the applications of what we were learning, and more. If you attend office hours he will be more than willing to answer your questions and he works to make sure that you actually understand the material.
His lectures were engaging because he drew many diagrams to help with understanding concepts. He did a good job explaining what he was looking for in terms of grading.

Best lecturer I've ever had - he writes out his thinking, includes fun (relevant) stories, and answers questions succinctly, non-judgmentally, and clearly. The class is hard, it's not his own fault; there's just genuinely a lot of material to cover. The textbook is free. Block is a very approachable instructor who truly cares about his students.

Dr. Block is a friendly teacher. His lectures are amazing. Great ppt style that's easy to follow, and some jokes/experiences/historical stories during lectures. CHEM 109 is not an easy class, but if you get 80% on each test and do all other work, you can still get A. He answers most student questions and got me interested in chemistry major again.

Professor Block is a fantastic lecturer and he was very thorough especially for a class with a ton of material like Chem 109. His exams are difficult but very fair although the grading at times can be pretty harsh as he expects a lot. He keeps lectures interesting by telling stories or jokes and I would definitely take a class with him again.

His lectures are annotated, so it is easy to follow along. However, to succeed in this class, you will probably need to attend office hours. He is very accessible outside of class, but you are also able to go to the other 109 professors for help. Labs are pretty difficult.

I LOVED having Dr. Block as my general chemistry professor. Lectures are productive and well organized (he takes time to answer student questions and finishes daily material) He will use a student answer to a pre-class question and go over how he would grade the response on exams, so you have a clear idea of what the graders are looking for!

Dr. Block is a great lecturer, but terrible with assigning labs. One particular lab we were given absolutely no instruction on how analyze data and the video given was almost entirely irrelevant to our goal. Additionally, the pre-lab work didn't cover what we had to do. A little effort would've been nice from this teacher in regards to the labs.
Dr. Block is super nice and a very approachable person. His sense of humor made lectures enjoyable, and he genuinely wants and believes that his students will succeed.

Dr. Block was a fantastic professor. While the large class sizes can make you feel small, there are numerous resources available for feedback and Dr. Block is very accessible outside of class. His lectures are clear and engaging, but you'll need to regularly complete significant amounts of pre-work to understand what's going on.

Dr. Block was a great professor! He is soft spoken so it makes him seem less intimidating and more approachable, but is also extremely intelligent. He incorporates funny stories into his lectures to keep engagement up! Although there was a lot of textbook reading and was pretty discussion-heavy, Chem 109 was enjoyable because of him!

I had Dr. Block for Fall of 2021 and I loved 109! He gave a lot of work but not a lot of it was busy work. Each assignment had a purpose. There was a discussion, a homework assignment, 2-3 pre-class readings and activities, a prelab and a lab in a given week. Every one of those assignments helped me understand chemistry. He and the TAs were helpful

If you are great at and interested in chemistry, you will do amazing in this class. If not, avoid it. Run away. Professor Block has the hardest exams out of all chem 104 professors. Do not take this class if you want to be happy.

Kind, approachable, and understanding, but lectures were watching him grade impossibly hard questions that were never seen on exams. Some find it nice that he has the biggest curve (I ended with an AB), but I felt defeated when an A was actually a 50% on exams. I wish I took a prof with easier exams that didn't make me feel terrible about myself.

Amazing lectures! Made content interesting and easy to understand. Tests were all free response and short on time, but were manageable. Plenty of opportunities to boost your grade outside of exams (labs, discussion worksheets, homework). Course was extremely well organized and the textbook was helpful. Highly recommend this professor and class.

Block is a great lecturer who breaks down complex concepts into something understandable. Lectures were posted online. Exams seem simple and short, but are quite a time crunch with very in-depth concept-heavy written responses. If you can reason through them though, you'll be just fine. Plenty of opportunities to boost grade outside of tests.

Lectures recorded, but live is much better. Weekly quiz, pre lab, lab, and discussion, as well as pre-class work before every lecture. Almost everything was graded by TAs, which often lacked explanation for why points were taken off. Wished the grading was handled better, but good teacher and reasonably tough class so you learn how to study.

Amazing prof. Really good at explaining things, and his lectures were pretty helpful. He is also really down to earth and approachable. Decent amount of homework, but overall pretty manageable for a 5 credit class. Course was very well organized. Exams were somewhat tough, but get better as semester progresses. Can't recommend this guy enough.
Dr. Block is a legend, great guy and fantastic professor. Extremely smart but good at explaining.

Great professor, very nice and definitely knows what he's talking about. In terms of test difficulty, you do have to study but if you took AP Chem or have a strong chem background, you'll do perfectly fine. The entire semester's content is just AP Chem but a bit more in depth. It's not at all hard to do well in his class.

Professor Block is pretty down-to-earth and funny, tries to make lectures as enjoyable as he can. Readings aren't necessarily mandatory, but you definitely need to do them to understand the material and do well on tests. Tests are pretty difficult so definitely recommend getting ahead on your work so you have more time to review and ask questions.

Prof Block's lectures make me want to fall asleep. His tone of voice is not engaging and sometimes the jokes fall flat. He is a fine person and the structure is well laid out. The class was hard and very indecisive when it came to curving it or not. Put a lot of effort into podia.
Amazing lecturer, the best of my college experience so far. Nothing was too tough but you definitely had to work for it. Yeah I legit want to be this guy's friend.

Chem 109 isn't an easy class but Professor Block makes in manageable. His lectures reinstate some of the main concepts from the textbook, and he does a good job at listening to student feedback on what we need help on. He also seems to care about his student's success in the class, as he answers questions quickly and makes grading criteria known.

This class is the hardest class I have ever took. Do NOT take this class if you can avoid it. Dr Block is a great guy, funny too, but this class is very hard. I regret not taking Chem103/104. Exams are very difficult, and you will only succeed if you study for an ungodly, significant amount of time every week. Great Prof, terrible class.

Best Professor ever!!! I really like Dr. Block's lecture because he makes complicated concepts easier to understand and uses interesting metaphors. I like his little humor, really makes my day. The class is fairly easy if you pay attention and read the book before going to the class. Really care about students, reply to emails fast with qualities.
Extremely difficult exams which somehow someone aces each time. Tests are weighed roughly the same as the labs. Relatively easy to exceed for an advanced class. Great Professor, No complaints.

Dr. Block is very passionate about chemistry and I think that shows through his lectures. Lectures are not super helpful if you read the textbook (which is assigned to do) but do help to provide some clarity. He is humorous during lecture which helps with the entertainment factor. Exams are as difficult as expected and uncurved, but not impossible.

The format of Dr. Block's lectures was very unhelpful. They consisted of small talk and problems that were extremely difficult and often beyond the scope of the course, and were never really relevant to exam questions. My highest exam grade came after skipping an entire week's worth of lectures. Dr. Block was really caring and approachable though.

Dr. Block is an amazing teacher and human being that truly cares about his students. Yes, his exams are difficult and his class is a lot of work, but both reward students who have put in the time to really understand the chemistry at a deep level. Would definitely take again.

Dr. Block needs to learn how to be warm to his students. Deciding to give an exam, group quiz, quiz, lab and 3 large and complicated homework assignments within the span of 14 days before the final amounts to straight up coldness. absolutely would not take again. Take at your own peril.
Stephen likes punishing his students more than he likes helping them. absolutely would not take again

Professor Block may be a nice guy, but I would strongly encourage you to take chem 104 with any other professor if you have the chance. His exams are ridiculous and don't even compare to the rest of the chem department. He goes out of his way to make a general chemistry course 10 times harder than it should be.

I think that Prof. Block is a great person and great professor. His class is a very tough one though, since he uses more conceptualized concepts for writing tests, the way you learn material is vastly different than how you are assessed. Just be ready to go far more in-depth concept-wise and have a strong base understanding of chem.

Dr. Block is criminally underrated. He is able to uniquely connect multiple chemistry aspects to modern day problems (like climate change). His lectures are insightful for problem solving and don't just rehash things that was done in pre-class. During office hours he's a conversationalist and will answer any questions you have to fullest extent.

Dr. Block is a amazing. He is very knowledgeable and cares for his students. His exams are fairly hard, but they are reasonable and fair. What he covers in class/lecture really helps with overall understanding. He team-taught with Etienne Garand, and I loved having both! They are amazing at explaining confusing topics and providing feedback.

He's a super nice guy, but his exam averages this semester were 49 & 52 for the first 2 tests. The other professors average MUCH higher. His class is extremely difficult, don't take him. Just don't. Unless you have extensive experience with chemistry coming in, you will struggle.

If you are thinking about taking Block do not. Take literally any other professor. Although he is very nice and an overall good lecturer who cares about his students, his exams were head and shoulders more difficult than the other professors teaching the same class. Averages on first 2 exams were 49 & 52. Do yourself a favor and take a diff prof.
He is a great professor and has a fun humor. He is a tough grader and believes in a true curve, but that being said I would take this class with him again in a heartbeat.
He is super funny during the lectures and he does a really good job explaining what he is looking for when grading tests.
Tests were a bit difficult, but if you read the textbook properly and go through the lectures and discussion once, you would clear them. Amazing professor and does has a good sense of humour.

Super great guy and made lectures very interesting. Tests were definitely very hard and honestly, I wouldn't recommend chem 109 over 103/104 unless you have to. Material is fairly interesting and Block is an awesome professor but the class itself is definitely very challenging.
Great professor! He made it clear how tests are graded, which was really nice. It's important to keep up with reading.
I really enjoy the pre-class chat, it's really a fun during the online session!

He was always clear on what was expected of students and was very patient and thorough in his explanations. I highly suggest maximizing all of the course resources, especially the extra practice problems. I never took AP Chem and was nervous about taking Chem 109, but Professor Block definitely helped me succeed and I always felt supported by him!
Professor Block was great. Did everything I could expect from a Chem professor and was also very fun and charismatic. This class was great and I fully recommend it.

I really enjoy Prof. Block. He's a really nice person and very intelligent. HOWEVER, I would never recommend taking Chemistry 109 to anyone. Very difficult and honestly not worth all the work that it is. I regret taking 109 instead of 103/104. If you must take 109, get ready to work your butt off
Block did a wonderful job during the lecture/meeting periods going extremely in depth to question answers. Very good guy and was always in a good mood!

Professor Block was amazing he does a really great job of fully explaining concepts and he tries to make sure all questions are answered completely and clearly. He lectures at a good pace and sets clear expectations for grading. The class is very hard but manageable if you did well in AP-Chemistry and are willing to do the work.
Hands down, best chem professor. The class is hard, though, so get ready for it
Tough class, definitely requires some work, but this professor does a good job of making his content engaging and answering questions.
Dr. Block has a wonderful sense of humor. He makes Chemistry more enjoyable for sure.
Dr. Block is an amazing person and lecturer. If given the chance, attend office hours where he gives 1 on 1 guidance and alternate, simplified versions of thinking about complex subjects

What a fantastic chem professor! He really knew what he was talking about and would tell stories that related to the materials that would help you understand the topic better. His tests are a little harder than the other professors, but he would ask the class what they needed clarification on the day before the test. Great professor and person!

Dr. Block was a great professor for a challenging class. He is incredibly smart, but always worked his hardest to explain the material in a clear way. I'd definitely recommend going to his office hours--he really took the time to make sure every student was set up for success if they put in the effort! Overall really great guy

Dr. Block definitely knows what he's talking about; but, he tends to be very wordy and over explains things, making them more difficult to understand than they should be. If you understand chem, he's awesome. If you don't, he's available outside class, but hard to understand explanations. Way harder exams than other professors, but bigger curve.

Personally I believe Stephen Block is one of the best lecturers at UW. From counting down the seconds until the start of lecture to the stories he tells, you can tell he truly cares about his students. He is truly hilarious and an absolute genius. His exams were harder than other professors thus yielding lower averages, but the curve helps.

Dr. Block is awesome. Be prepared for very difficult exams. Dr. Block has very high expectations of his students, but he is honestly one of the smartest people I have ever met. He is truly one of the best. If you put your BEST effort in and go to his office hours/ study sessions, you will succeed. 10/10 would take again.

Dr. Block is an excellent professor. Communication with students was great and created an environment where expectations for class were very clear. It was obvious that he cared about the success and well-being of all students. Dr. Block was accessible outside of class by email or in office hours. He also navigated the switch to online class well.
By far the best professor I have ever had! Even when the content was difficult I enjoyed the class because of him. I would highly recommend this professor!!!
Prof Block is a great guy. Really cares about how his students do & his lectures were great. Explains topics well and made a really tough class tolerable.

Arguably the best professor I've had. He really cares about students and chemistry education. His vocabulary is bigger than yours, but he uses it well and precise language is important in teaching chemistry. Class is very structured, and if you do everything they tell you you will succeed. Always go to lecture, discussion, and do the assignmentsA.

Block is really awesome in lecture. His slides are very concise and he covers lots of content in each lecture, while not making it seem overwhelming. Block makes lecture interesting by throwing in interesting stories and nerdy jokes on a regular basis. Overall I would be glad to take a class with him again.
A very good general chemistry professor. His lectures were fairly engaging.

The content taught in this course is really challenging. Exams were difficult, and there was a lot of pre-class and lab prep. Nevertheless, Dr. Block was the best lecturer I couldve asked for. Hes kind, brilliant, fair, understanding, and cares about his students a lot. Fast response time to emails and questions. He gave us a generous curve.

Frequent exams. three midterm and a final will be given in the three and half month semester. The course itself is hard, so the class is fast. Dr. Block is trying to explain everything well, and he generally did it. Just something is unclear. All faculty are accessible outside of class on Piazza. Be prepared to use 10 hour per week on this courses.

Professor Block is one of the most intelligent people I have known. However, this translates to a lot of what he says going over his students' heads. He relies heavily on pre-class work and tends to not explain some topics as well as he should. The tests are hard and averages are generally around 58-60%. There's a lot of work outside of class too.
